name: Wrest Point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has gorgeous views from the rooms - we stayed in the executive suites on level 10 although extremely dated and plain decor. Nothing to rave on about with inside the room.
reviews.title: Great Views of a beautiful City

reviews.text: Concierge EXCELLENT free valet parking, nice entrance, the buffett meal was the best buffett I have eaten in a long time.
reviews.title: drab, noisy, remote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dated building on the outside but cheap accommodation we only paid around the $150 for top of the range rooms.
reviews.title: Amazing ...

reviews.text: By far the worst place I stayed during my three-week Australia trip. Be warned that this is a casino with lodging attached: if you are not prepared to stay up all night gambling and drinking, your rest will certainly be disturbed by those who are. I have never stayed at a noisier establishment: the laughter and yelling carried on until after 2 am, in rooms, in the hallway, any place two or more people congregated. My "mountain side room" for $119 may have been on the mountain side; all I could see was a parking lot on street level. The interior of the room was dismal. It is a drive to anything worth seeing in Hobart. Would never never stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel in absolutely amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wrest Point while visiting family. Wonderful warm welcome, and we were priviliged to be upgraded from our water's edge room into a Tower room on the 10th floor, with water views. When I say water views, it was a full panoramic view of the river, the Eastern Shore, Sandy Bay and the Tasman bridge (beautiful lit up at night).
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
The most ridiculous wait for elevators
reviews.text: Pros
- Large waterfront location with most rooms having expansive views of the harbor
reviews.title: Nothing's changed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Close location to many restaurants and shops nearby
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: - Casino for 24/7 entertainment
reviews.title: Will stay again!

reviews.text: - Since this is a casino, lots of restaurants, bars and eateries, even one that closes at 5am
reviews.title: Don't book the Waters Edge at Wrest Point unless you are very fit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at two hotels in Hobart and observed something odd:
reviews.title: Needs renovation but terrific service at an affordable price

reviews.text: - the other hotel had poor service but great facilities
reviews.title: Nice view but dated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - this hotel (Wrest Point) had ordinary facilities with amazing service
reviews.title: Disgusting Service, Rude Staff, Dated Decor = DISGRACE

reviews.text: The young lady on Reception was so friendly, charming and welcoming that we left her a nice little tip (which I hope was passed on to her!)
reviews.title: Very helpful staff, quiet and clean rooms, but located far from the center of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a bit daggy, old and need updating. New furniture and carpet is a must.
reviews.title: Ok - but not great

reviews.text: Wrest Point Tower was everything we expected, comfortable, well serviced with excellent helpful and genuinely friendly staff. It was good value for money and I would recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Very pleasant - great staff - great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge and room staff stood out in our experience as being near the top of anyone's expectations. They made a huge difference to the enjoyment of the stay and nothing was too much trouble. Full Marks.
reviews.title: Good clean but not near enough to city centre

reviews.text: Only tiny things are negative, such as the awkwardness of the power plug for the kettle - but this is so minor as to scarecly need mentioning.
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was comfortable, well equipped and kept very clean - the facilities were good and the room service was efficient.
reviews.title: Enjoyable!

reviews.text: I would have liked more family areas in the hotel but as it was a casino much was dedicated to gambling and not therefore for children. The pool and spa were very popular.
reviews.title: Exceptional service and views to die for!

description: A spectacular location on the sparkling River Derwent, first-class accommodation, fine dining, a range of entertainment and million dollar views from the window of every room – Wrest Point is the perfect choice for a memorable stay in Hobart, Tasmania’s harbourside capital city. With a range of accommodation standards, four restaurants, five bars, live music every night, some of the hottest international and national acts, and a boutique casino, Wrest Point has something for everyone.
